topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5560fafd6368724e74f90000#post_5560fafd6368724e74f90000
My biased opinion: they are trying far too hard to be "serious" and "mature"

Which usually translates to dark, brooding, and sometimes gory aka batman! Batman! BATMAN!


Not that's its hurting their sales any, they still sell 33% of comics. Marvels is about 35%

Edit: its an actual editorial mandate that DC heroes CANNOT lead happy lives.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5560fc9563687204143e0100#post_5560fc9563687204143e0100
For the most part, yeah.

The irony is before it was marvel that tended to have a more cynical look at how heroes would operate while DCs were more optimistic.

Mind you marvel isn't all happy go lucky by any means, but they're a bit more open to camp and stupid now.
topics.author: 500757fd7f123b75a90003b1

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5560fafd6368724e74f90000#post_5560fafd6368724e74f90000
A big part of it is that they're chasing the Cinematic Universe thing while ignoring some important parts of what Marvel did to make their own successful.

For the most part Marvel took things slow with phase one, leaving themselves lots of wiggle room to grow their stories and characters after introducing them. 

DC seems to be trying to cram all the big stuff in front while doing no real setup.

He is now one of the most popular marvel hero's and a used to promote other books ala wolverine, spidey, or deadpool
